Package sx.blah.discord.modules

This package contains everything relating to Discord4J "modules".

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IModule
    This class represents a Discord4J "module", implement it to create a new Module.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Configuration
    This is used to configure the module behavior in Discord4J.
    ModuleLoader
    This class is used to manage loading and unloading modules for a discord client.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Requires
    This annotation is used to mark a module as having a dependency on another module.

Package sx.blah.discord.modules Description

This package contains everything relating to Discord4J "modules". Modules are like addons to Discord4J, they add additional, optional features. While bots aren't required to use this module system, it is recommended as it allows for multiple bots to work at the same time.

There are two stages to module loading:

First, the class loading. If a jar file's MANIFEST.MF includes an attribute called "Discord4J-ModuleClass", then it will load only that class and skip the recursive search. If there is more than one IModule implementation than the classes should be listed, separated by a semicolon ";". This method is recommended as it saves on loading overhead. When Discord4J searches for a class implementing IModule, it will first check the jar file's MANIFEST.MF for the "module-requires" property. If that property exists, Discord4J will attempt to load a jar file containing a class which corresponds to the value of that property first, preventing any class loading errors (NOTE: "module-requires" must be in the form "package.name.ClassName" and multiple classes can be specified by separating them with semi-colons).

Second, the instance loading. When a new IDiscordClient is created, its ModuleLoader instance will attempt to enable all class-loaded modules. In order to do this, the module loader first verifies that the module is compatible with the current Discord4J version by creating a new instance using a default constructor (constructor with no args) and then comparing the current Discord4J.VERSION with the IModule.getMinimumDiscord4JVersion(). If that check is passed, that instance of IModule then is registered as an event listener and it has the IModule.enable(sx.blah.discord.api.IDiscordClient) method called for it.
